intro: Rhamnus neapolitana, commonly known as the Naples buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 2–4 meters and features small, dark green leaves that turn red in the autumn. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, followed by black, oval berries that are an important food source for birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden landscaping.
